intro: Dichromena exaltata, commonly known as the tall dichromena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. Dichromena exaltata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky areas.
